While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

While mixing in a new handbag or pair of shoes is an easy way to freshen your seasonal wardrobe, there are other cost-effective ways to accessorize. One simple yet visually powerful way to make a fashion statement is with a great pair of earrings. Whether you prefer studs, hoop earrings, or pearls, there's a wide range to choose from, especially when shopping on Amazon. Many of the digital retailer's options are priced under $25 but look much more expensive. We're talking Sofia Richie–level glam. (Yes, we found a dupe for her oval-shaped diamond studs, and obviously, it's on the list.)

While shopping for earrings on Amazon may mean opting for metal alloys or other cost-effective materials instead of solid gold, rest assured that there are plenty of high-quality choices that'll withstand frequent wear. (Yes, that goes for those of you who wear the same pair on repeat.) Ahead, we've curated nine of our favorite earrings from Amazon, all of which boast high ratings, and we've included editor-favorites and bestsellers as well. Keep reading to shop our favorites for you and your stylish loved ones, and prepare to be convinced that affordable jewelry can look luxe.

Our Favorite Earrings on Amazon

  • The faux diamond studs that look like Sofia Richie's but for way less: Raneecoco Store Stud Earrings at $21
  • The huggies you'll reach for every single day: ALEXCRAFT 925 Sterling Silver Earrings at $10
  • The only faux diamond stud set you'll ever need: WSSXC Store 6 Pairs Stud Earrings Set at $10
  • The caged pearl earrings that look luxe: Barzel 18K Gold Plated Caged Pearl Stud Earrings at $13, originally $20
  • The pearl drop earrings that'll earn you compliments at weddings: Gold Huggie Small Hoop Pearl Drop Earrings at $13

Updated on June 27, 2025 at 1:00PM ET: Updated prices and checked stock for all products. User reviews may have been lightly edited for clarity.

Best Celeb-Inspired Earrings

Raneecoco Store Stud Earrings ($21)

We couldn't resist going down a rabbit hole on Amazon when we spotted a pair of oval-shaped faux diamond studs that instantly reminded us of the ones Sofia Richie wore in a chic mirror selfie. Hers are probably the real deal, but this lookalike version delivers the same quiet-luxury feel — minus the likely four-figure price tag.

  • Pros: Lookalike for Sofia Richie's diamond studs; Includes extra earring backs and a cleaning cloth
  • Cons: Some reviewers say they aren't as sparkly as expected
  • Material: 18K white gold-plated 925 sterling silver
  • Colorways: 1
  • Who it's best for: Those who want the diamond look without the diamond price

What Reviewers Say: "I love these earrings. They are so sparkly. They look every bit as pretty as my real diamonds. They come packaged nicely and include a second set of soft cushy backs that I love, a cute jewelry box to store them in, and a nice jewelry cloth. I got the medium size (5 mm), and they are perfect, not too big, so they do look real. I plan to get a second pair in a different shape. Highly recommend."

Best Huggies

ALEXCRAFT 925 Sterling Silver Earrings ($10)

We're big fans of huggie earrings around here! They're the kind of no-brainer accessory you can wear on repeat without thinking twice. This $10 pair nails the brief: simple, versatile, and available in both silver (pictured here) and gold. At that price, we suggest adding both to your Amazon cart.

  • Pros: Versatile enough to dress up or down; Features a secure clasp
  • Cons: Brand claims they're sterling silver, but some reviewers suspect they're silver-plated brass or copper
  • Colorways: 2
  • Who it's best for: Those seeking budget-friendly earrings that work for everyday wear

What Reviewers Say: "These pearl huggie hoops are the perfect mix of simple and elegant. The gold finish looks great, the pearls have a nice subtle shine, and they're super lightweight, with no tugging at all. The clasp feels secure, and they go with everything from casual outfits to dressier looks."

Best Earring Set

WSSXC Store 6 Pairs Stud Earrings Set ($10)

You're looking at Amazon's top-selling faux diamond earring set. It comes with six pairs, which breaks down to less than two bucks each, and the range of sizes makes it easy to match your studs to your outfit (or your mood).

  • Pros: Over 25,000 five-star ratings; Nice sparkle; Includes six studs in varying sizes
  • Cons: Reviewers note the gems may loosen over time
  • Material: Surgical steel and cubic zirconia.
  • Colorways: 11
  • Who it's best for: Great for those who love having options — and a little sparkle — for every occasion

What Reviewers Say: "My favorite set of earrings. These have become my daily earrings. I am very surprised by the quality and amount of sizes available for the price of the set. I have been using these daily for a long time now and have not seen any issues with quality or wear and tear. A common issue I see with some earrings is the posts are really short, but that is not an issue with these."

Best Caged Pearl Earrings

Barzel 18K Gold Plated Caged Pearl Stud Earrings ($13, originally $20)

Classic pearl studs will always have their place, but this caged design feels like a unique upgrade. They only come in gold, but with a style this chic, that's all you really need.

  • Pros: Compliment-magnet, according to reviewers; 6mm pearls are a just-right size (not too big, not too small)
  • Cons: Mixed reviews on their durability
  • Material: Gold-plated brass
  • Colorways: 1
  • Who it's best for: Those looking for a modern twist on classic pearl studs

What Reviewers Say: "These are absolutely stunning, elegant, and beautifully crafted with high-quality materials. From the very first day I wore them, I received multiple compliments! The design is simple yet sophisticated, and the pricing is very reasonable for the quality. They're incredibly versatile — you can dress them up with a black velvet dress or keep them casual with jeans and a blouse. Either way, they add a touch of elegance to any outfit."

Best Pearl Drop Earrings

Gold Huggie Small Hoop Pearl Drop Earrings ($13)

We clearly have a soft spot for pearls, especially when they show up in unexpected ways, like this pair of pearl drop earrings (and the ones in the aforementioned slide). Honestly, why not add both to your cart? They're budget-friendly and versatile enough to work for everything from casual brunches to dressed-up nights out.

  • Pros: Elegant for special events; Also available in non-pearl drop styles; Tarnish-resistant
  • Cons: Some reviewers noted they were smaller in person than expected
  • Material: Gold-plated copper
  • Colorways: 1
  • Who it's best for: Anyone looking for an elegant pair of earrings for a low price

What Reviewers Say: "These pearl huggie hoops are the perfect mix of simple and elegant. The gold finish looks great, the pearls have a nice subtle shine, and they're super lightweight, with no tugging at all. The clasp feels secure, and they go with everything from casual outfits to dressier looks."

Best Knot Earrings

SHERLOVE Trendy Gold Knot Earrings ($13)

You've probably seen a version of these earrings on your favorite celebs and influencers. The original goes for $110, but this pair offers nearly the same look for a tiny fraction of the price.

  • Pros: Hypoallergenic; Available in multiple sizes; arrive in a gift-ready box.
  • Cons: Some found the post of the earring filmsy
  • Material: Gold-plated brass
  • Colorways: 3
  • Who it's best for: Anyone who wants a trendy look without the splurge

What Reviewers Say: "These gold earrings are gorgeous and lightweight, perfect for everyday wear or special occasions. The looped design is unique and eye-catching without being too flashy. They come in a secure, elegant display frame, which is a nice touch for gifting. Comfortable to wear, with extra backings included. Great value for the quality!"

Best Designer-Inspired Earrings

Apsvo Chunky Gold Hoop Earrings ($13)

Sure, you could drop designer-level cash on a pair that costs as much as a mortgage payment, but thousands (including one of our editors) are making the switch to this affordable Amazon version instead. Learn more in our Apsvo Chunky Gold Hoop Earrings review.

  • Pros: Convincing dupe for a thousand-dollar pair; Available in a two-pack with gold and silver; Multiple size options to choose from
  • Cons: Some noticed a faint seam where the earring was fused together
  • Material: Gold-plated brass
  • Colorways: 11
  • Who it's best for: Those looking for a budget-friendly designer dupe

Editor Quote: "Having worn them to a fall wedding recently, I can confirm they're worth the hype. Not only do they look expensive, but the best thing about them is they're lightweight, which I found especially surprising giving their chunky teardrop shape and substantial size. While wearing them, I don't even feel them in my earlobes, unlike others that I've owned that feel heavy and like they're pulling." — Marisa Petrarca, contributing editor, Shopping

Best Chunky Hoops

PAVOI 14K Gold Plated Lightweight Chunky Open Hoops ($14, originally $16)

We're not exactly sure when chunky hoops became the accessory, but their reign isn't letting up anytime soon. This pair is a standout, available in gold-plated copper or a more durable 18K gold vermeil option if you're planning to wear them nonstop.

  • Pros: Available in both 14K gold-plated copper and a more durable 18K gold vermeil option; Comes in multiple sizes; Lightweight
  • Cons: Brand doesn't specify the base metal used for the 14K gold-plated version
  • Material: Gold-plated copper or brass or 18K gold vermeil
  • Colorways: 3
  • Who it's best for: Those who prefer chunky, statement hoops over delicate styles

What Reviewers Say: "I got these in May 2024, and I still have them in June 2025. They are just as gold as they were when I got them over a year ago. Literally the best purchase I've ever made from Amazon."

Best Paperclip Earrings

PAVOI 14K Gold Plated Convertible Paperclip Link Huggie Hoop Earrings ($15)

Beyond their obvious cool factor, these paperclip earrings are convertible, meaning, can take them apart and wear the links as huggies instead. It's basically two pairs in one.

  • Pros: Convertible design lets you wear each hoop separately or stacked together; Size guide available on the Amazon storefront to help visualize the 22mm length
  • Cons: Some shoppers found the closure difficult to open
  • Material: White gold-plated brass or copper (unspecified)
  • Colorways: 4
  • Who it's best for: Those who want a trendy, versatile pair that can be worn multiple ways to get more out of their purchase

What Reviewers Say: "I am a repeat customer of this company. Their gold-plated jewelry is some of the best I have found for the price. They have never tarnished, and the gold remains intact for a much longer period of time than other costume jewelry I've owned."

Marisa Petrarca (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping and has over seven years of experience writing and editing beauty, fashion, and lifestyle content. She was previously the senior beauty editor at Grazia USA and the style and beauty editor at Us Weekly. Now freelancing, her work has been featured in Cosmopolitan, Allure, Marie Claire, and more.
